Your Brain and Diabetes
KEY POINTS
Your brain is sensitive to the amount of glucose (sugar) it receives.

When your brain receives too little blood, brain
cells can die.
Diabetes can damage blood vessels in the brain and cause a stroke or memory loss.
High blood sugar over time damages blood vessels in the brain that carry oxygen-rich blood.
Both high and low blood sugar can damage blood vessels in the brain.
This can cause problems with memory and thinking and eventually can lead to vascular dementia .
I Have Diabetes and Cancer.

Keep brain health top of mind
You can take steps to improve or prevent problems with brain health and diabetes, such as:
Follow a healthy eating plan.

These healthy habits can help you manage your
diabetes and support your brain health.
When your brain doesn't get enough sugar, it also doesn't get enough oxygen.

You can help protect your brain by keeping your blood sugar levels close to your
target.

In fact, the brain is the most energy-
demanding organ.
To do all its work, your brain uses sugar in your blood for energy.
Diabetes affects every major organ in the body.
